Our hotel recommended Llamber for lunch.  It was one of the few places open around 3 p.m. for lunch.  Llamber is located near the El Born Culture Center in Barcelona.  We had the choice of eating in the bar or in the dining room and opted for the dining room.The restaurant is decorated in a rustic hipster posh decor.  We were provided with the English menus and it was recommended that we order the lunch menu for 15.50 euro.  They had a great selection of tapas, but we decided to go with the tapas menu because it provided the best deal.For starters, we had a carrot ginger soup.  It was served with a branzino toast.  The next course was a foie gras with rice.  The foie gras was in the sauce.  The next course was the fish and chips served in a cone.  The final course was a beef ravioli.  The pasta in the ravioli was very delicate.For our dessert, we were given the option of a local cottage cheese with honey or pears poached in wine.  We opted for the pears poached in wine and it was a great finish to the meal. The lunch special comes with wine, beer, coffee, or water.  Since we drank so much the night before, we stuck to wine.  Wine on the cocktail menu was reasonably priced and there were a lot of options sold by the glass.Overall, it was a great restaurant and fun for people watching.
